text: Manoel Cândido Pinto de Oliveira GCSE, GCIH (; 11 December 1908 – 2 April 2015) was a Portuguese director and screenwriter. At the age of 106, he is thought to be the second oldest movie director, just behind George Abbott at 107. Manoel de Oliveira was born in Cedofeita, Porto and was raised as a Roman Catholic. He began making movies in 1927. Oliveira married Maria Carvalhais on 4 December 1940. They have four children together that were all born in the 1940s. When he was younger, Oliveira competed as a race car driver.Randal Johnson, Manoel de Oliveira (Urbana: University of Illinois Press, 2007), p. 5 He was also an athlete competing in the pole vault event. de Oliveira died on 2 April 2015 in Porto from heart failure, aged 106. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1908 births Category:People from Porto Category:Portuguese movie actors Category:Portuguese movie directors Category:Portuguese screenwriters Category:Portuguese movie producers Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:Disease-related deaths in Portugal Category:Centenarians Category:Portuguese Roman Catholics Category:2015 deaths Category:Pole vaulters
